message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: public void print(Map<String, Integer> map){
    Iterator<Map.Entry<String, Integer>> iterator = map.entrySet().iterator();
    for (int i = 0; i < map.size(); i++){
        Map.Entry<String, Integer> entry = iterator.next();
        System.out.println(entry.getValue() + " = " + entry.getKey());
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use an iterator to iterate over the LinkedHashMap and access the elements using an index. In the code provided, we create an iterator using map.entrySet().iterator() and then use iterator.next() to get the next entry in the map. We can then access the value and key using entry.getValue() and entry.getKey().
